intro: Astronidium ponapense, commonly known as the Pohnpei starfruit, is a tropical shrub native to the island of Pohnpei in the Caroline Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwood trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and oval-shaped fruits that resemble starfruits. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
